repnme.cdata!:
Rwanda - Public Sector Capacity Building
            Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Public Sector
            Capacity Building Project for Rwanda was aimed at building
            the capacity of public sector entities for a more efficient,
            effective, transparent, and accountable performance in their
            newly redefined roles and functions. The major changes in
            this paper are: (i) changes in the project's
            development objectives and results monitoring framework by
            reducing the scope of the Project Development Objective
            (PDO) and streamlining the number of key performance
            indicators used in the project; (ii) change in project
            components and re-allocation of credit proceeds across
            components to ensure efficient utilization of project
            resources and to reflect the changing priorities of
            government; (iii) changes in implementation arrangements to
            adapt the project to the new institutional structures
            created by the government; (iv) alignment with the new
            country financing parameters; (v) transiting to new
            procurement guidelines for International Bank for
            Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) loans and
            International Development Association (IDA) credits
            published in May 2004 and revised on October 1, 2006; and
            (vi) extension of project closing date for two years from
            December 31, 2009 to December 31, 2011.

repnme.cdata!: Rwanda - Public sector capacity building project

abstracts.cdata!:
This report on Multi-sectoral Capacity
            Building deals with the project to strengthen public sector
            capacity (PSCBP) that seeks to increase the capacity of
            public sector entities for more effective, efficient,
            transparent and accountable implementation, in their roles
            and redefined functions and for the success of their
            strategic objectives contributing to the implementation of
            Reduction Strategy Document (PRSPs). PSCBP supports the
            implementation of the expanded program of government, the
            Multi-sectoral Program to strengthen capacity (MSCBP), which
            seeks to minimize any lack of competence resulting from the
            effects of war and genocide by strengthening capacity at
            central and local levels of government, the private sector
            and civil society
